It says in your instructions that we need to use the FSM branch of Komodo to build Sudoku. Is that correct?
How does that correlate with building from the `jl777` branch for ROGUE?
Do we need to have separate `komodod` installations for ROGUE and SUDOKU

column2: when this instruction was written ROGUE doesn't exist yet.

column1: In general it's possible to build Sudoku compatible client from any branch
column2: only difference is that daemon with sudoku cclib (same cclib as musig needs) instead of  roguecclib needed.

column1: Now by default rogue cclib building. Easiest way to build SUDOKU client on fresh installation is change string `./makerogue` to `./makecclib` in `zcutil/build.sh` /  `zcutil/build-mac.sh` / `zcutil/build-win.sh`
```How does that correlate with building from the jl777 branch for ROGUE?```

In #cc-rogue channel description information that ROGUE should be built from FSM branch so not sure why it's needed to be built from jl777. All CC stuff is recommended to build from FSM because it's more stable";"";"";
